tfield hash code implementation inconsistent with equals which breaking bug you know what hash codes are and are familiar with java object api then you already know what talking about basically java requires that you overriden hashcode and equals then any two objects that are equal they must return same hash code tfield class api contract isnt clear about what considered equality but according tfield equals implementation fields are equal and only both objects are tfield generalizing here theres another subtle bug lurking with class checking but thats another story fields both have same type and other words fields are equal without regard name and this follows overall thrift architecture which field names are little more than window dressing and ids carry semantics unfortunately includes name hash code calculation ! this completely breaks object contract makes hash code inconsistent with equality put another way two fields foo and bar could have same type and and foo equals bar would return true but they would given different hash codes ! ! this completely forbidden and means that with this bug you cannot use tfield key map example even reliably keep set tfield this simply broken per java object api contract

analysis steps selectstmt and analysiscontext are large and cumbersome there ample evidence literature that simpler smaller functions are easier understand and debug than larger more complex functions this ticket requests breaking large functions these two cases into smaller easier understood units preparation tracking down issues related missing rewrites where and group clauses one might argue that large functions perform better eliminating unnecessary function calls however planner not performance sensitive and dozen extra calls that this change introduce will not change performance given thousands calls already made experience has shown that jit compiler jvm actually does better job optimizing smaller functions and gives when functions get large creating smaller functions may actually allow jit compiler generate better code and this refactoring support possible outcome that planner can handle rewrites without making multiple passes through analyzer that savings will far outweigh few extra calls this change introduces

scenario weve seen play out couple times this impala admin sets memory based admission control but sets default query mem limit this means that admission control will use memory estimates instead mem limit typically admins want some protection from large queries consuming excessive memory but cant dont want set single mem limit because workload unknown unpredictable this configuration has caveats and recommend against but this happens and often works well enough long workload comprised relatively simple queries caveats include there enforcement that query stays within memory estimate this means that query can fail force other queries fail memory estimates are often inaccurate this unavoidable since they depend cardinality estimates which are commonly off even with state art query planners this means that runnable queries may impossible admit without setting mem limit something changes about workload new query added stats are computed data size changes make otherwise innocuous planner change then run into second problem above and one more queries cannot executed rejected query from pool root foo request memory needed greater than pool max mem resources use mem limit query option indicate how much memory required per node total memory needed per node mem limit times number nodes executing query see admission control documentation more information last problem problem this jira intending work around preferred solutions which work most time are configure default query memory limit pool set mem limit query disable memory based admission control and admission control based num queries which simpler and easier understand would however useful have third fallback cases where first two options are difficult impossible apply basic requirement allow administrator configure resource pool such that queries with very high estimates can run probably need enough flexibility that they can run concurrently with other smaller queries big query shouldnt take over whole pool and ideally would also have mem limit applied query that were still protected from runaway memory consumption long term solution this impala this short term workaround that can tide users over until have comprehensive solution

thanks nick probably worth broader discussion view hbase that hbase database and should therefore provide types pretty different from bigtables design many ways bigtable resembles database shares many implementation strategies with databases but bigtable provides different interface than such systems bigtable does not support full relational data model instead provides clients with simple data model that supports dynamic control over data layout and format and allows clients reason about locality properties data represented underlying storage bigtable also treats data uninterpreted strings although clients often serialize various forms structured and semi structured data into these strings clients can control locality their data through careful choices their schemas while you could preserve flexibility here while providing one implementation type model hbase think its explicit existing design decision have hbase support multiple distinct type models higher level systems and those systems want share code and type models thats great but imo hbase storage system explicit type model design and start lose above benefits bring type awareness into core hbase components like

need able perform series reads from and writes single row without any potential interference from other clients unfortunately this bit involved because normal reads currently not acquire row locks requires adding additional get getrow calls that obtain and release row lock addition there will two additional client calls lockrow unlockrow which actually acquire and release locks though each lock associated with hregion this will tracked within hregionserver when lock acquired from client handled much like scanner obtain row lock from hregion store region name and lock identifier synchronized map and also obtain lease ensure that lock will eventually released even client dies this also required adding rowlocklistener implements leaselistener private class hrs handle row lock lease expiration hrs lockrow will return long lockid openscanner does that will used subsequent client calls reuse this existing row lock these calls will check that lock valid and perform operations without any locking wrappers around get new versions batchupdate openscanner etc this going really add some noise list available htable client methods not sure its something people would want commit into normal release regardless this does provide some very convenient functionality that may useful others are also looking into clint morgans hbase but one major downside that there significant amount overhead involved this row locking already built and this will only extend api allow clients work with them directly there little overhead all only obvious performance consideration that this should only used where necessary rows will not locked and unlocked quickly with round trip client calls our design will have specific notes our schema about which tables even which families columns must accessed with row locks all times and which not this first attempt adding any additional functionality comments criticism code reviews are encouraged should have patch tomorrow
